meanings.definition: To cut into pieces with a sharp tool
meanings.sent1: She was chopping vegetables for dinner.
meanings.sent2: The chef was chopping onions in the kitchen.
meanings.sent3: The lumberjack was chopping wood with great enthusiasm.
meanings.sent4: The sculptor was chopping away at the marble block to reveal the hidden statue.
meanings.sent5: The sound of chopping echoed through the forest as the woodcutter worked.

meanings.definition: The act of cutting something into pieces
meanings.sent1: The loud chopping of the knife could be heard in the kitchen.
meanings.sent2: The rhythmic chopping of the axe filled the air in the lumberyard.
meanings.sent3: The chopping of the cake at the party signaled the start of celebrations.
meanings.sent4: The chopping of the waves against the rocks created a soothing sound.
meanings.sent5: The chopping of the scissors as she cut the paper was precise and neat.

meanings.definition: To strike or hit something with a sharp tool or weapon
meanings.sent1: He was chopping at the tree with all his might.
meanings.sent2: The warrior was chopping at the enemy's shield in battle.
meanings.sent3: The pirate was chopping at the ropes to free the captured ship.
meanings.sent4: The blacksmith was chopping at the metal to shape it into a sword.
meanings.sent5: The gardener was chopping at the stubborn roots to clear the flower bed.
